title: Set maximum concurrent user sessions per DB user in IdM Admin Portal
content:
In the suite IdM Admin Portal, DB users are either of the Regular type or System type, which are account users or integration users in Suite Administration, respectively. The suite IdM has a setting to control the maximum concurrent sessions per DB user of the Regular type.


Note This setting doesn't take effect on DB users of the System type in IdM. In other words, this setting has no effect on integration users defined in Suite Administration and hence won't break integrations that use an integration user. 
  1. Log in to Suite Administration as suite-admin: https://<External Access Host>/bo.
  2. Click Tenants and then open a tenant. 
  3. Click the IdM Settings tab to open the IdM Admin Portal.
  4. Click Customization on the left side navigation pane, and then select the AUTHENTICATION tab.
  5. Set the Concurrent Session Maximum value. 
    The default value is -1, which means there's no limit on the number of concurrent sessions per DB user. 
    For best security, it's recommended to not allow multiple sessions for a single user from multiple locations. To do this, you can set the value to 1. 
  6. Click SAVE.
